prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a long, rectangular, metallic object with a cylindrical hole in the center. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.0375, 0.0]. Next, create the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the coordinate system. 1. Face 1: a. Loop 1: i. Line 1: Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.0312, 0.0]. ii. Line 2: Draw a line from point [0.0312, 0.0] to point [0.0625, 0.0]. iii. Line 3: Draw a line from point [0.0625, 0.0] to point [0.0625, 0.75]. iv. Line 4: Draw a line from point [0.0625, 0.75] to point [0.0312, 0.75]. v. Line 5: Draw a line from point [0.0312, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.75]. vi. Line 6: Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.0]. b. Loop 2: i. Circle 1: Draw a circle with the center at point [0.0312, 0.0625] and a radius of 0.0188. c. Loop 3: i. Arc 1: Draw an arc from point [0.0156, 0.1406] to point [0.0469, 0.1406] with the midpoint at [0.0312, 0.125]. ii. Line 1: Draw a line from point [0.0469, 0.1406] to point [0.0469, 0.2969]. iii. Arc 2: Draw an arc from point [0.0469, 0.2969] to point [0.0156, 0.2969] with the midpoint at [0.0312, 0.3125]. iv. Line 2: Draw a line from point [0.0156, 0.2969] to point [0.0156, 0.1406]. After the 2D sketch is created, scale the sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector provided by the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.0375 toward the normal and no extrusion in the opposite direction of the normals. The sketch scale is 0.75. The extrusion is a new solid body. The height of this part is 0.75, the width is 0.0375, and the length is also 0.75.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: A Tapered Rectangular Prism Construct a tapered rectangular prism as the base part. Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Sketch Now, create a sketch on the XY-plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) with a single loop (loop\\_1). The loop, in turn, consists of 8 line segments, listed as line\\_1 through line\\_8, described below: 1. line\\_1: Start Point - [0.0, 0.0], End Point - [0.5804, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point - [0.5804, 0.0], End Point - [0.5826, 0.0] 3. line\\_3: Start Point - [0.5826, 0.0], End Point - [0.5883, 0.0] 4. line\\_4: Start Point - [0.5883, 0.0], End Point - [0.5883, 0.0595] 5. line\\_5: Start Point - [0.5883, 0.0595], End Point - [0.5826, 0.0595] 6. line\\_6: Start Point - [0.5826, 0.0595], End Point - [0.5804, 0.0595] 7. line\\_7: Start Point - [0.5804, 0.0595], End Point - [0.0, 0.0595] 8. line\\_8: Start Point - [0.0, 0.0595], End Point - [0.0, 0.0] The loop is a closed loop, meaning the end point of the last line segment (line\\_8) is the same as the start point of the first line segment (line\\_1). Extrusion Extrude the sketch along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.0017 units. The sketch scale for this extrusion is 0.5883. Operation This operation results in the creation of a new solid body. Description The final shape is a tapered rectangular prism, with the following dimensions: 1. Length: 0.5883 units 2. Width: 0.5883 units 3. Height: 0.0017 units This concludes the construction of Part 1, the tapered rectangular prism.</description>

prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with Two Circular Holes on Opposite Sides** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.1921, 0.0) **Sketch** Now, create the sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. Follow the same pattern to create the geometry on the remaining faces. *Face 1* Face 1 is composed of three loops: loop_1, loop_2, and loop_3. *Loop 1*: Contains four lines (line_1, line_2, line_3, line_4) that form a rectangle. *Start Point - line_1*: (0.0, 0.0) *End Point - line_1*: (0.58, 0.0) *Start Point - line_2*: (0.58, 0.0) *End Point - line_2*: (0.58, 0.75) *Start Point - line_3*: (0.58, 0.75) *End Point - line_3*: (0.0, 0.75) *Start Point - line_4*: (0.0, 0.75) *End Point - line_4*: (0.0, 0.0) *Loop 2*: Contains a single circle (circle_1) with center (0.2993, 0.5653) and radius 0.0924. *Loop 3*: Contains a single circle (circle_1) with center (0.3251, 0.2438) and radius 0.0924. Both Loop 2 and Loop 3 represent the two circular holes in the rectangular prism. **Extrusion** Extrude the sketch to create the solid model with the following properties: * Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.1921 * Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 * Sketch Scale: 0.75 * Operation: New body (create a new solid) The final shape has a length of 0.75, width of 0.1921, and height of 0.75. Note: Do not add any additional assumptions. Provide only the instructions mentioned in the JSON without any additional details.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: 3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top Edge** *Shape and Dimensions* Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. The length of the prism is approximately 0.75 units, the width is around 0.05 units, and the height is also 0.75 units. *Coordinate System* Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler Angles set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the Translation Vector set to [0.0, 0.05, 0.0]. This will position and orient the part correctly in the assembly. *Sketch (Face 1)* Create a sketch (Face 1) in the XY plane of the new coordinate system. Follow these steps to create and constrain the sketch entities: 1. Draw a line (line_1) from the point [0.0, 0.6492] to the point [0.075, 0.575]. 2. Draw a line (line_2) from the point [0.075, 0.575] to the point [0.075, 0.375]. 3. Draw a line (line_3) from the point [0.075, 0.375] to the point [0.075, 0.0]. 4. Draw a line (line_4) from the point [0.075, 0.0] to the point [0.25, 0.0]. 5. Draw a line (line_5) from the point [0.25, 0.0] to the point [0.25, 0.375]. 6. Draw a line (line_6) from the point [0.25, 0.375] to the point [0.25, 0.75]. 7. Draw a line (line_7) from the point [0.25, 0.75] to the point [0.24, 0.75]. 8. Draw an arc (arc_1) clockwise from the point [0.24, 0.75] to the point [0.01, 0.75], with the center point at [0.125, 0.635]. 9. Draw a line (line_8) from the point [0.01, 0.75] to the point [0.0, 0.75]. 10. Draw a line (line_9) from the point [0.0, 0.75] to the point [0.0, 0.6492]. Apply the necessary constraints to enforce closed and smooth loops: - Constrain line_1 to be tangent to arc_1. - Constrain line_2, line_3, and line_4 to be collinear. - Constrain line_5, line_6, and line_7 to be collinear. - Constrain line_9 to be tangent to arc_1. *Extrusion* Use the sketch as a profile to create a 0.05 unit deep extrusion along the positive Z direction (towards the normal). The scaling parameter for the sketch should be set to 0.75. Finally, create a new solid body using this extrusion.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Long, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Step 1: Create a New Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] This will serve as the reference frame for the entire CAD model. Step 2: Draw a 2D Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Step 3: Create Faces and Loops In the sketch, draw five lines to create two rectangular faces using the following vertices: - Face 1: - Loop 1: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0437] to [0.0437, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.0437, 0.0] to [0.0874, 0.0437] - Line 3: [0.0874, 0.0437] to [0.0874, 0.75] - Line 4: [0.0874, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] - Line 5: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0437] This forms a closed loop around Face 1 and completes the boundary conditions for the 2D sketch. Step 4: Scale the 2D Sketch Apply the sketch scale factor of 0.75 to the entire sketch. Step 5: Transform the 2D Sketch to 3D Apply the following Euler angles and translation vector to transform the 2D sketch to the final 3D part: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] This ensures the 3D part is aligned with the original coordinate system. Step 6: Extrude the 3D Model Extrude the 3D model by a distance of 0.0221 towards the normal, and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Step 7: Describe the Part The final shape is a long, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. - Shape: A long, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.0221 By following these steps, the junior CAD designer should be able to generate an accurate CAD model of the part.</description>
